Key Match Events: Jason Heyward hit a go-ahead, two-run homer and made a dazzling defensive play.
Alex Bregman and Kyle Tucker each added a solo home run for the Astros.
Ryan Pressly retired Mitch Garver on a flyball and Josh Hader struck out J.P. Crawford to preserve the lead.
Josh Hader struck out Victor Robles and Julio Rodríguez to earn his 34th save.
Framber Valdez permitted eight hits and three runs in 5 2/3 innings for the win.
Jorge Polanco homered among his season-high four hits and had two RBI for the Mariners.
Post-Match Reflections: First-year Astros manager Joe Espada was overwhelmed as the final out was recorded, expressing his emotional connection to the team and their journey.
Seattle manager Dan Wilson reflected on the difficulty of watching the Astros celebrate but emphasized the importance of continuing to fight in the postseason race.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Jason Heyward, who signed with the Astros last month after his release by the Dodgers, is filling in for Yordan Alvarez, who is out with a knee sprain.
Heyward made a leaping catch in left field, crashing into the metal scoreboard and knocking out a panel with his left hand.
